creator: John.Bize@ExceptionalSoftware.com
text:
In the build.xml file, I had to add ignoresystemclasses="true" to the 
<available> task in the jmxCheck target, because Ant was finding MBeanInfo, 
but I don't env have ${jmx.jar} set.  This was causing my build to fail of course.

creator: John.Bize@ExceptionalSoftware.com
text:
I don't think you want the Ant project modifying the log4j build.xml file.

In log4j-1.2.8 build.xml at line 122, I changed:
    <available classname="javax.management.MBeanInfo" property="jmx-present">
to:
     <available classname="javax.management.MBeanInfo"
                property="jmx-present"
                ignoresystemclasses="true">

I appologise for not being explicit enough.

What happens if the ignoresystemclasses attribute is left as is? The only side 
effect I see is building the o.a.log4j.jmx package into log4j.jar which is not 
bad per se.

--
Ceki
creator: ceki@apache.org

text:
The jmx-present check supposes that the jmx class files are contained within  
${jmx.jar} (property). There is no reason why that should be the case.

  <classpath>
    <pathelement location="${jmx.jar}"/>
  </classpath>

should be changed to

 <classpath refid="compile.classpath"/>
